intro: Echinocereus rubescens, commonly known as the red-tipped hedgehog cactus, is a species of cactus native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in spines and bright red tips, which are most prominent during the blooming season. The plant produces vibrant yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Echinocereus rubescens is a hardy, drought-tolerant plant that is often used in xeriscaping due to its low maintenance requirements.
